result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin N. Diamond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Dustin N. Diamond was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dustin N. Diamond is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Dustin N. Diamond was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Dustin N. Diamond was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

miscConds.notes: Court costs paid from bond posted. Travel costs of $363.65 paid from bond posted. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-No contact with victim, C.S.
-Defendant may not enter the Grand Ave Saloon in Port Washington.
-Pay supervision fees.

**Pursuant to Order signed 7/21/2015-defendant's sentence stayed pending appeal.
**12/16/2015 Hearing held-stay of probation term lifted effective 1/15/2016. Defendant to report to the Ozaukee County Department of Corrections on that date. Jail term will commence on 1/15/2016 at 6:30 pm.

Hearing held 9/1/2015 / Court sets restitution amount. Restitution paid in full from bond posted. Restitution joint and several with Amanda Schutz.  The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Consecutive to: Ct. 2

Defendant Dustin N. Diamond in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed defendant is withdrawing his appeal on this case, defendant requesting until 1/15/2016 to lift stay of sentence. DA no objection. Court lifts stay and orders sentence commence on 1/15/2016 including probation term. Defendant to commence serving sentence on 1/15/2016 at 6:30 pm, he shall report to probation department earlier on that date. Bail conditions to remain in full force and effect until that date.
Court reviewed signed stipulation of counsel. Court will require defendant to appear in court. Clerk contacted Atty. Fay, case will remain on the calendar today. DA notified.

Defendant Dustin N. Diamond in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti and Atty. Daniel Fay. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Alberti states Atty. Daniel Fay will represent defendant on the appeal. Atty. Fay informs the court the motion for stay is for jail term only, not probation term. DA no opposition to stay of jail term pending appeal. Court grants motion and orders entire sentence stayed pending appeal. Court adjourns case for 60 days to check status of appeal process. Atty. Alberti to submit Order. Bail to condition with previous conditions to remain in effect.

Defendant Dustin N. Diamond in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti. Defendant Amanda Schutz in court with attorney Anthony Cotton.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties prepared to continue trial.

  9:05 am    State rests. Defense reserves right to make a motion.
  9:05 am    Atty. Cotton opening statement.
  9:08 am    Dustin Diamond sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Alberti.
10:34 am   Court/counsel/jury recess. 
10:52 am   Atty. Gerol statement. Court/counsel discussion.
10:58 am   Jury present in court. Dustin Diamond resumes stand with crossexam by Atty. Gerol. 
12:14 pm   Jury excused for objection. Court recess.
12:22 pm   Dustin Diamond resumes stand with crossexam by Atty. Gerol. 
12:30 pm   Court/counsel/jury Lunch recess to 1:30 pm.
  1:35 pm   Court in session. Dustin Diamond resumes stand with crossexam by Atty. Gerol,
                    redirect by Atty. Alberti.
  2:00 pm   Defense rests.
  2:01 pm   Jury excused. Court examines defendant Amanda Schutz as to her right to testify.
                    Court/counsel discussion regarding rebuttal evidence.
  2:08 pm    Jury in Court. All parties rest.
  2:12 pm    Jury excused. Jury instruction/verdict conference.  Atty. Alberti motion for summary judgment/Atty. Cotton motion for directed verdict.
                    Court denies both motions.
  2:30 pm    Court recess.
  3:12 pm    Closing statement of Atty. Gerol.
  3:37 pm    Closing statement by Atty. Cotton.
  3:46 pm    Closing statement by Atty. Alberti.
  4:00 pm    Rebuttal statement by Atty. Gerol.
  4:14 pm    Court instructs the jury. 
  4:43 pm    2 alternate jurors struck.
  4:44 pm    Bailiff sworn. 
  4:45 pm    Jury leaves for deliberation.  
  7:15 pm    Court/counsel/defendant's in court. Atty. Christopher Ehrfurth appears for Atty. Anthony Cotton. Jury submits question, court reads question to counsel.
  7:18 pm    Jury in court. Court clarifies portions of video requested by jury.
  7:22 pm    Jury excused and returns to deliberate. Court/counsel discussion.
  8:10 pm    Court/counsel discussion regarding jury view of DVD.  
  9:15 pm    Court/counsel discussion regarding how long jury will be allowed to deliberate tonight.
10:15 pm    Court/counsel in court with discussion on how to proceed. Court recess.
10:22 pm    Court is informed verdict has been reached.
10:35 pm    Court/counsel/defendants/jury in court. Verdict read as to Dustin Diamond: Ct. 1 Not Guilty   Ct. 2 Guilty   Ct. 3 Guilty  Answer: "Yes"   Verdict read as to Amanda Schutz  Ct. 1 Guilty
10:36 pm    Jury polled, jury thanked and excused. Court grants judgment on the verdict. Defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict. Court denies motion. 
                     Court schedules sentencing for 6/25/2015 at 8:45 am.
submitted by Atty. Cotton

Court will rule at a later time regarding this testimony. Witnesses to be sequestered. Court recess. Court in session.

Defendant Dustin N. Diamond in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Alberti motion to admit video. Court will admit video as long as it's in real time.  Atty. Alberti motion to allow video testimony of Dr. Walrod and expert testimony of Adam Campbell.  State opposes Dr. Walrod's appearance by video. Court will require Dr. Walrod's personal appearance.  Court will review testimony of Adam Campbell on trial date. Court will not permit a copy of the DVD to be given to the news media at this time. After the trial, Court will allow news media access to a copy.

Defendant Dustin N. Diamond in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of information. Defendant enters not guilty plea to all counts. Atty. Alberti states he has filed a motion for reduction of bail. Atty. Alberti to discuss bail reduction with DA Gerol. Bail to continue. Court orders bail reduced to $5000.

Arraignment on January 22, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Dustin N. Diamond in court with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Ryan Hurda sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Alberti. State rests. Defense rests. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. On request of defense counsel, Court adjourns arraignment. Court will permit defendant to leave the State of Wisconsin for employment purposes.
Preliminary hearing on January 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

State of Wisconsin appears by Attorney Patti Wabitsch. Defendant Dustin Diamond appears in court with Attorney Thomas Alberti. Counsel received copy of complaint and waives reading. Counsel addresses motion to reduce bail. Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 11:00 am. Court sets orders.
Jury Demand
to Release Defendant and Set Reasonable Bail

State appears by Attorney Adam Gerol. Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Wilfred DeJunco. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender. Counsel waives reading. Court advises defendant of penalties. Court finds probable cause. State requests $15,000 cash bail with conditions. Counsel requesting $500 cash bail. Counsel requesting status of preliminary hearing; waiving time limits. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing. Court orders $10,000 cash bail with conditions: no contact with taverns/bars, no contact with C.S., absolute sobriety, not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription, and not to possess any weapons. Status hearing scheduled for 12-29-14 at 1:30 pm.
